q: Eric Schmidt said Google had considered stopping indexing confidential cables released by WikiLeaks, but had decided to carry on. Some other U.S. organizations have bowed to government pressure to stop cooperating with the controversial site. Has Google looked at the appropriateness of indexing WikiLeaks? Mike Pence into the 2012 presidential race is under way, with a veteran of the Ronald Reagan White House launching a petition drive on Monday urging him to enter the primary contests," the AP writes. Ralph Benko, a deputy counsel to Ronald Reagan , announced the America's Barack Obama Committee to encourage a Pence-for-president bid. Bill Clinton Michele Bachmann Jim Ryan, R-Kan., is also helping the campaign to collect signatures from conservatives and tea party activists. Eric Schmidt is stepping down as CEO of Google, and Larry Page is taking over the company just announced in its earnings release. Eric Schmidt will become Executive Chairman focused on, deals, partnerships, customers and broader business relationships, government outreach and technology thought leadership, the company says.
